issue.title: Mouse Tooltip Translator

labels.name: Idea-New PowerToy
labels.description: Suggestion for a PowerToy

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Description of the new feature / enhancement

Anywhere we select a word or stand on it, it must be possible to translate it when we press a button or a shortcut, or just a pop-up window appears.
We can choose the translation engine
The ability to read the translated sentence by voice.

### Scenario when this would be used?

Anywhere text or image, such as the Samsung Pen and the instant translation feature on any image or text

### Supporting information

_No response_

comment.body:
/dup [18014](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/18014)
more one, this feature is really wanted

commits.message:
[EnvVar]Mark and disable editing of user variables that are applied by a profile (#29451)

* [EnvVar] Mark profile variable in user variables

* Mark backup variables

* Add tooltip to icon, put in header and disable editing of applied var

* Use completed icon instead

* Better var name and comments

---------

Co-authored-by: Jaime Bernardo <jaime@janeasystems.com>

pull_request.title: [EnvVar] Mark profile variable in User variables list
pull_request.body:
<!-- Enter a brief description/summary of your PR here. What does it fix/what does it change/how was it tested (even manually, if necessary)? -->
## Summary of the Pull Request
 - Mark variables from applied profile in User variables list
 - Mark backup variables in User variables list
 - Disable Edit/Remove for those variables in User variables list

<!-- Please review the items on the PR checklist before submitting-->
## PR Checklist
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/57057282/cb2a5960-07f5-4f2c-9bc5-eefc7d4c43ff)


- [ ] **Closes:** #xxx
- [ ] **Communication:** I've discussed this with core contributors already. If work hasn't been agreed, this work might be rejected
- [ ] **Tests:** Added/updated and all pass
- [ ] **Localization:** All end user facing strings can be localized
- [ ] **Dev docs:** Added/updated
- [ ] **New binaries:** Added on the required places
   - [ ] [JSON for signing](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/main/.pipelines/ESRPSigning_core.json) for new binaries
   - [ ] [WXS for installer](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/main/installer/PowerToysSetup/Product.wxs) for new binaries and localization folder
   - [ ] [YML for CI pipeline](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/main/.pipelines/ci/templates/build-powertoys-steps.yml) for new test projects
   - [ ] [YML for signed pipeline](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/main/.pipelines/release.yml)
- [ ] **Documentation updated:** If checked, please file a pull request on [our docs repo](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/windows-uwp/tree/docs/hub/powertoys) and link it here: #xxx

<!-- Provide a more detailed description of the PR, other things fixed or any additional comments/features here -->
## Detailed Description of the Pull Request / Additional comments

<!-- Describe how you validated the behavior. Add automated tests wherever possible, but list manual validation steps taken as well -->
## Validation Steps Performed

Let's get this in soon to get the String localized eventually.
I assume any UI tweaks can come later.

issue.title: Mouse Highlighter leaving primary button circles behind

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.74.1

### Installation method

PowerToys auto-update

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Mouse Utilities

### Steps to reproduce

I can't reliably reproduce
The issue is intermittent

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

No artefacts left behind on screen - the mouse highlight circle to go away

### ❌ Actual Behavior

Intermittently the mouse highlight circle 
only for primary button (no secondary)
gets left behind on the screen

If I switch off the "Mouse highlighter" feature then the screen is cleared of any persistent highlights


### Other Software

_No response_

issue.title: Powertoys Run does not search Google Drive for Desktop

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Product-PowerToys Run
labels.description: Improved app launch PT Run (Win+R) Window

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

labels.name: Run-Results (Indexer)
labels.description: Issue with file search in PowerToys Run

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.74.1

### Installation method

GitHub

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

Download Google Drive for Desktop app > use PowerToys Run to search a file/folder > No result detected

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

I expect PowerToys Run to be able to search Google Drive for Desktop - however, it fails to do so. Please fix this issue. Spotlight on macOS correctly searches Google Drive for Desktop.

### ❌ Actual Behavior

PowerToys Run was unable to search Google Drive for Desktop despite all searching index being completed.

### Other Software

_No response_

comment.body:
Hi @shounakchattopadhyay
Are you able to search these files in start menu?
PowerToys search works through windows search indexing and require the folders to be indexed: https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/powertoys/run#windows-search-settings
/needinfo

payload.description: Windows system utilities to maximize productivity

issue.title: [WinUI] Blank window for PowerToys Settings app on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit Build 19045

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Dependence-WinUI 3
labels.description: Dependency on WinUI

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.74.0

### Installation method

Microsoft Store

### Running as admin

None

### Area(s) with issue?

Settings

### Steps to reproduce

I am experiencing an issue with the PowerToys Settings app on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit Build 19045. I have an old HP Compaq dc7700 Slim Form Factor (SFF) PC with 4GB RAM and no Secure Boot capability due to its legacy BIOS and MBR mode partition (no UEFI or GPT support). 

The PowerToys Settings app does not display any content or options when I launch it. It only shows a blank window with the standard buttons at the top right corner. The window color changes with the light or dark mode, but nothing else happens. I have included a screenshot of the blank window and a copy of my sysinfo entries for reference. I would appreciate any assistance to resolve this issue. 

Note that this PC is using the following latest graphic driver (installed by Microsoft by default when installing Windows 10 Pro; confirmed by this [driver database page](https://treexy.com/products/driver-fusion/database/display-adapters/intel/q965-q963-express-chipset-family/)):
```
Intel® Q965/Q963 Express Chipset Family (Microsoft Corporation - WDDM 1.1)
Intel Corporation
8.15.10.2697
10/1/2012
Intel Corporation
Intel® GMA 3000
1920 x 1080
32
4294967296
60 Hz
75 Hz
59 Hz
Internal
Running at full power
This device is working properly.
PCI bus 0, device 2, function 0
PCI\VEN_8086&DEV_2992&SUBSYS_2801103C&REV_02\3&B1BFB68&0&10
```


1. Launch the PowerToys app from the Start menu or the desktop shortcut.
2. Right-click on the PowerToys icon in the icon tray in the task bar and select Settings from the context-sensitive menu.
3. Observe the behavior of the app when it tries to load the settings interface.

Thank you.

![Screenshot 2023-10-21 125714](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/1452656/99ee1906-e799-4cbe-aee8-fefe1aa9e3b1)

[sysinfo.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/13059858/sysinfo.txt)

[Detailed-System-Report.pdf](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/13059987/Detailed-System-Report.pdf)

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

The expected behavior for this app regarding the issue is that it should display the settings options and menus for the PowerToys modules, such as FancyZones, PowerRename, Image Resizer, etc. The app should also allow the user to customize the settings according to their preferences and needs. The app should not show a blank window or fail to load the settings interface. The app should be compatible with Windows 10 Pro Build 19045 and work on any PC that meets the minimum system requirements, regardless of the BIOS, boot or partition mode.


### ❌ Actual Behavior

The PowerToys does not display the settings options and menus for the PowerToys modules, such as FancyZones, PowerRename, Image Resizer, etc. The app also does not allow the user to customize the settings according to their preferences and needs. The app shows a blank window or fails to load the settings interface. 


### Other Software

Not relevant. The PowerToys features work as expected but I couldn't access its Settings.

comment.body:
<detail>

<summary>List of installed .NET versions</summmary>


```ps
PS C:\Users\gfn> Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP' -Recurse | Get-ItemProperty -Name version -EA 0 | Where { $_.PSChildName -Match '^(?!S)\p{L}'} | Select PSChildName, version

PSChildName Version
----------- -------
Client      4.8.09037
Full        4.8.09037
Client      4.0.0.0
```

</detail>

issue.title: Remapping a key

labels.name: Issue-Bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Needs-Triage
labels.description: For issues raised to be triaged and prioritized by internal Microsoft teams

issue.body:
### Microsoft PowerToys version

v0.74.1

### Installation method

Microsoft Store

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Keyboard Manager

### Steps to reproduce

My key "ý7" on the Czech keyboard does not work. Therefore, I need to remap the key 
![r](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/6a28fc7c-4720-4e7e-aa6e-96078323ca85)
 to 
![t](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/03996abb-c5e6-4cd2-b4fc-85fce001af78)
". I suppose I need to choose VK 253 (lower key ý), which is impossible because the application offers codes only up to VK 252 
![VK](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/08f30d63-ede3-4875-8c58-1084cff80ad9)
. How shall I do it?

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

I expected to press 
![r](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/c6418fd1-013f-4029-8c39-2fc26bb3e5cb)
and write
![t](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/63725e82-970f-4413-a99e-0163438edc40)


### ❌ Actual Behavior

It writes "7", which is upper key, not "ý". To write  this I need to press 
![čárka](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/149147406/878c8b68-4ae2-4345-bd28-7af50804a234)
and then "y".

### Other Software

PowerToys
Windows 11

issue.title: Re-do Flyout window: Win 11 Start style, hotkeys, on/off

labels.name: Idea-Enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request on an existing product

labels.name: Needs-Community Feedback
labels.description: We need additional help with how something should act / look

labels.name: Area-User Interface
labels.description: things that regard UX for PowerToys

issue.body:
### Description of the new feature / enhancement

Looking at the flyout, there are a few thing I would like to improve.

- It has the same size, position and style as Windows 11 Start menu
- It can be opened via a click on the tray icon, and with a keyboard shortcut (think of combining with Shortcut Guide)
- It displays _all_ modules
- All modules that can be activated directly, can be clicked on to open
- It shows the hotkeys next to the module names
  to provide a solution for countless requests as in #15405
- For e.g. Keyboard Manager, we can show the remaps in a drop-down area, just like Win 11 Start menu has
- It has buttons for:
  - Download Update (when available)
  - Open Settings window
  - Go to online documentation
  - Create a zip file / bug report
  - Open GitHub repo
  - Close (not ~quit~)

### Quick concept

![New FlyOut (a la Win 11 Start) v2](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/assets/65828559/11ee8757-716e-41a5-af30-74e57246ccf5)

comment.body: @TheJoeFin one of the many things people ask for is that those are still too "far away" in terms of quick opening. People want a shortcut, just like Shortcut Guide has.
